name: Eric Kord Henderson
content: Eric Henderson - Computer Science Skip to main content Computer Science People Faculty Eric Henderson Eric Henderson Eric Henderson, Ph.D. Clinical Associate Professor CCP 257 Call: (208) 426-5766 ehenderson@boisestate.edu About Eric Henderson, Ph.D Bio Education Area Of Interest Bio Eric has many years of experience developing innovative software and hardware products in the networking industry. Prior to joining Boise State, he held senior roles in management, development, and engineering at Xcom Labs, M-87, Xirrus, Intel, and Xircom, driving system architecture to rapidly deliver award winning products to market. Eric received his BS in ECEN and his MS in Computer Science from Brigham Young University, and MPhil and PhD from Cambridge. He is named in several patents related to his work in the networking and communications field. Education Ph.D. in Computer Science from Cambridge University, Cambridge, England MPhil from Cambridge University, Cambridge, England MS in Computer Science from Brigham Young University BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Brigham Young University Area of Interest NLP – textual meaning extraction and semantic representation, distributional text processing, dialog systems ML – neural networks, genetic algorithms, feature engineering Networking – P2P protocols and applications Software – Mobile applications, emerging languages, embedded systems Computer Science computerscience@boisestate.edu (208) 426-5766 City Center Plaza (CCP), RM 364
